p: The specimens were then stored for 28 d at 37°C in the dark, with the staining solutions replaced every week to avoid excessive bacterial proliferation. After 28 d (t 1), specimens were rinsed with distilled water for 2 min and dried with absorbent paper followed by 12 h in a desiccator chamber. The evaluation of the specimens was performed on white background (WB) and black background (BB) to simulate the conditions of an incisal (BB) and interproximal or occlusal restorations (WB) [ 19].
